text: Daniel’s Vision of a Dazzling Heavenly Messenger

In the third year of Cyrus \add the\add* king of \add the\add* Persians, a word\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “matter,” or “message” \f* was revealed to Daniel, who was called \add by\add* his name Belteshazzar, and the word\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “matter,” or “message” \f* \add was\add* reliable and \add it concerned\add* a great tribulation,\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “conflict” \f* and he understood the word\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “matter,” or “message” \f* and ⸤he received understanding⸥.\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Literally “and understanding to him” \f*

In those days, I, Daniel, I \add myself\add*\f + \fr 10:2 \ft This is an emphatic use of the first person personal pronoun \f* was \add in\add* mourning ⸤for three whole weeks⸥.\f + \fr 10:2 \ft Literally “three weeks \fq of \ft days” \f*

I had not eaten \add any\add* choice food, and meat and wine did not enter my mouth, and ⸤I did not use any ointment⸥\f + \fr 10:3 \ft Literally “I have not anointed at all” \f* ⸤until the end of three whole weeks⸥.\f + \fr 10:3 \ft Literally “until being full/complete three weeks \fq of \ft days” \f*

And \add then\add* on \add the\add* twenty-fourth day of the first month, I \add myself\add*\f + \fr 10:4 \ft This is an emphatic use of the first person personal pronoun \f* was on the bank of the great river; that is, \add the\add* Tigris.
And I lifted up my eyes and I saw,\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Or “looked” \f* and there was a man, \add and\add* he was dressed \add in\add* linen, and his waist was girded with \add the\add* gold of Uphaz.

Now his body \add was\add* like turquoise,\f + \fr 10:6 \ft Or “yellow jasper” or other gold-colored stones; the exact identity of ancient precious stones is difficult \f* and his face \add was\add* like \add the\add* appearance of lightning, and his eyes \add were\add* like torches of fire, and his arms and his legs \add were\add* like \add the\add* gleam of polished bronze, and the sound of his words \add was\add* like \add the\add* sound of a multitude.

And I saw, I, Daniel ⸤alone⸥,\f + \fr 10:7 \ft Literally “to alone me” \f* the vision; and the people who were with me ⸤did not see⸥\f + \fr 10:7 \ft Literally “not they saw” \f* the vision; nevertheless, a great trembling fell upon them and they fled \add in order\add* to hide themselves.

And I myself, Daniel, alone saw this great vision, and \add as a result\add* ⸤no strength was left in me⸥\f + \fr 10:8 \ft Literally “not was left in me strength” \f* and ⸤my complexion grew deathly pale⸥,\f + \fr 10:8 \ft Literally “and complexion my changed over me to destruction” \f* and I did not retain any strength.

And I heard the sound of his words, and ⸤when I heard⸥\f + \fr 10:9 \ft Literally “at my hearing” \f* the sound of his words I myself \add began\add* falling into a trance on my face, ⸤with my face to the ground⸥.\f + \fr 10:9 \ft Literally “and my face toward the ground” \f*
And look, a hand touched me and it roused me to my knees\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Hebrew “on my knees” \f* and the palms\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Hebrew “palm” \f* of my hands.

And he said to me, “Daniel, \add a\add* man beloved, pay attention to the words that I \add am\add* speaking to you and ⸤stand upright where you are⸥,\f + \fr 10:11 \ft Literally “stand on your position” \f* for I have now been sent to you.” And ⸤while he was speaking⸥\f + \fr 10:11 \ft Literally “at his speaking” \f* with me this word,\f + \fr 10:11 \ft Or “matter,” or “message” \f* I stood up trembling.

And he said to me, “You must not fear, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand and to humble yourself ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 10:12 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* your God, your words were heard, and I \add myself\add*\f + \fr 10:12 \ft This is an emphatic use of the first person personal pronoun \f* have come because of your words.

But \add the\add* prince of \add the\add* kingdom of Persia stood ⸤before me⸥\f + \fr 10:13 \ft Literally “to front of me” \f* \add for\add* twenty-one days. And look,\f + \fr 10:13 \ft Or “finally” \f* Michael, one of the chief princes, came to assist me, and I left \add him\add* there beside \add the\add* king of \add the\add* Persians.

And I have come\f + \fr 10:14 \ft Hebrew “I came” \f* to instruct you about what\f + \fr 10:14 \ft Hebrew “that” \f* will happen to your people ⸤in the future⸥,\f + \fr 10:14 \ft Literally “at the end of the days” \f* for \add there is\add* a further vision \add here\add* ⸤for the future⸥.\f + \fr 10:14 \ft Literally “for the days” \f*
And while he was speaking with me according to these words, I turned my face toward the ground and I was speechless.

Then look, there was ⸤one in the form of a human⸥;\f + \fr 10:16 \ft Literally “as \fq the \ft likeness of \fq a \ft son of man” \f* he touched my lips and I opened my mouth and I spoke and I said to the \add one\add* standing ⸤before me⸥,\f + \fr 10:16 \ft Literally “to opposite me” \f* “My lord, because of the vision my anxieties fell upon me and I \add have\add* not retained \add my\add* strength.

So ⸤how am I, a servant of my lord⸥\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Literally “how is \fq he \ft able a servant \fq of \ft my lord this” \f* to speak with ⸤you, my lord⸥,\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Literally “with my lord this” \f* and I ⸤just now⸥\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Literally “from now” \f* ⸤have no strength in me⸥?”\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Literally “not it remains in me strength” \f*
And ⸤he again touched⸥\f + \fr 10:18 \ft Literally “he added to and touched” \f* me, ⸤the one in the form of a human⸥,\f + \fr 10:18 \ft Literally “like vision of a man” \f* and he strengthened me.

And he said, “You must not fear, \add O\add* beloved man. ⸤Peace be to you⸥;\f + \fr 10:19 \ft Literally “Peace to/for you” \f* be strong and be courageous!” And ⸤when he spoke⸥\f + \fr 10:19 \ft Literally “at his speaking” \f* with me, I was strengthened and I said, “Let my lord speak, for you have strengthened me.”

Then he asked, “Do you know why I have come to you? And now I return to fight against the prince of Persia and I \add myself\add*\f + \fr 10:20 \ft This is an emphatic use of the first person personal pronoun \f* \add am\add* going, and look,\f + \fr 10:20 \ft Or “listen” \f* \add the\add* prince of Javan\f + \fr 10:20 \ft That is, Greece \f* will come.

However, I will tell you ⸤what is inscribed⸥\f + \fr 10:21 \ft Literally “the being inscribed” \f* in \add the\add* book of truth, and there is not one \add who\add* contends with me against these \add beings\add* ⸤except⸥\f + \fr 10:21 \ft Literally “but if” \f* Michael, your prince.”
